title: How to Remove a Phone Number from Instagram: Mobile & Web

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This app icon looks like a camera lens icon on a pink and purple gradient background. Sign in if you aren't logged in already. Use this method to remove a phone number used to log into your Instagram account. Keep in mind you must have an email address you can use to replace your sign in method . To completely remove your phone number from Instagram, make sure to also disable faster logins , disable mobile two-factor authentication , and delete your synced contacts .

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You can find this at the bottom-right corner. Your profile page will open.

steps.title: Tap Edit profile.
steps.content: Tap Edit profile . This is underneath your profile picture and bio.

steps.title: Tap Personal information settings.
steps.content: Tap Personal information settings . You can find this near the bottom. Your Account Center settings will open.

steps.title: Tap Contact info.
steps.content: Tap Contact info . This is the first option.

steps.title: Tap Add new contact.
steps.content: Tap Add new contact . This is the blue button at the bottom. Before you can delete your mobile number, you must have another method to sign into your account.

steps.title: Add your email.
steps.content: Add your email. Tap Add email in the pop-up menu, enter your email address, and then tap Next . You will be asked to verify your email with a code sent by Instagram. Once verified, the email will be linked to your Instagram account. Return to the Contact information page.

steps.title: Tap your phone number.
steps.content: Tap your phone number. You should now see your email address above or below your linked phone number.

steps.title: Tap Delete mobile number.
steps.content: Tap Delete mobile number . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Delete again.
steps.content: Tap Delete again. Your phone number will be deleted. You'll now need to use your linked email address to log into your Instagram account.

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This app icon looks like a camera lens icon on a pink and purple gradient background. Sign in if you aren't logged in already. Use this method to remove your saved mobile number for faster logins with your Instagram account. This feature is only available for some devices and countries. If you want to remove your phone's synced contacts, skip to the third method instead.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You can find this at the bottom-right corner. Your profile page will open.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You can find this at the very top of the page, underneath Your account . If you don't have this option, tap Security instead. Then, skip the next step.

steps.title: Tap Password and security.
steps.content: Tap Password and security . This is in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Saved login.
steps.content: Tap Saved login . This is the third option. On some devices, this will look like Saved login info .

steps.title: Tap Turn off.
steps.content: Tap Turn off . If you see multiple accounts in the Accounts Center, select your Instagram account first to see this option. If you don't have the Accounts Center, tap the switch next to Saved phone number to toggle off your saved phone number for this account.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You can find this at the bottom-right corner. Your profile page will open. You may have your phone number connected to your Instagram account as a security method for two-factor authentication. Use this method to disable it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You can find this at the very top of the page, underneath Your account .

steps.title: Tap Password and security.
steps.content: Tap Password and security . This is in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Two-factor authentication.
steps.content: Tap Two-factor authentication . This is under Login & recovery .

steps.title: Select your Instagram account.
steps.content: Select your Instagram account. If you have more than one account, you'll see them listed here.

steps.title: Select the security method to disable.
steps.content: Select the security method to disable. In most cases, this will be Text message , where Instagram sends you a login code to your mobile phone number. If you see the options to Add instead, this means you currently don't have two-factor authentication set up with a mobile number.

steps.title: Remove the number.
steps.content: Remove the number. Depending on your device, Instagram may send you a code to confirm the disabling of two-factor authentication. Follow the on-screen instructions to turn off two-factor authentication with your phone number.

steps.title: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser. Use this method to remove a phone number used to log into your Instagram account. Keep in mind you must have an email address you can use to replace your sign in method. [2] X Research source To completely remove your phone number from Instagram, make sure to also disable two-factor authentication and delete your synced contacts .

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This is at the bottom-left corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is the cog icon.

steps.title: Click See more in Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click See more in Accounts Center . You can find this at the top.

steps.title: Click Personal details.
steps.content: Click Personal details . You can find this under the Account settings header.

steps.title: Click Contact info.
steps.content: Click Contact info . This is the first option.

steps.title: Click Add new contact.
steps.content: Click Add new contact . This is the blue button at the bottom. Before you can delete your mobile number, you must have another method to sign into your account.

steps.title: Add your email.
steps.content: Add your email. Click Add email in the pop-up menu, enter your email address, and then click Next . You will be asked to verify your email with a code sent by Instagram. Once verified, the email will be linked to your Instagram account. Return to the Contact information page.

steps.title: Click your phone number.
steps.content: Click your phone number. You should now see your email address above or below your linked phone number.

steps.title: Click Delete mobile number.
steps.content: Click Delete mobile number . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Click Delete again.
steps.content: Click Delete again. Your phone number will be deleted. You'll now need to use your linked email address to log into your Instagram account.

steps.title: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser. You may have your phone number connected to your Instagram account as a security method for two-factor authentication. Use this method to disable it.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This is at the bottom-left corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is the cog icon.

steps.title: Click See more in Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click See more in Accounts Center . You can find this at the top.

steps.title: Click Password and security.
steps.content: Click Password and security . This is in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Click Two-factor authentication.
steps.content: Click Two-factor authentication . This is under Login & recovery .

steps.title: Select your Instagram account.
steps.content: Select your Instagram account. If you have more than one account, you'll see them listed here.

steps.title: Select the security method to disable.
steps.content: Select the security method to disable. In most cases, this will be Text message , where Instagram sends you a login code to your mobile phone number. If you see the options to Add instead, this means you currently don't have two-factor authentication set up with a mobile number.

steps.title: Remove the number.
steps.content: Remove the number. Depending on your device, Instagram may send you a code to confirm the disabling of two-factor authentication. Follow the on-screen instructions to turn off two-factor authentication with your phone number.

steps.title: Disable contacts syncing on the Instagram app.
steps.content: Disable contacts syncing on the Instagram app. Before you can delete all your synced contacts , you must first disable contacts syncing on all devices logged into the Instagram app. [3] X Research source Do the following: Open the Instagram app on your mobile device(s). Tap your profile icon in the bottom-right corner. Tap ☰ Menu . Tap Accounts Center . Tap Your Information and Permissions . Tap Upload Contacts . Select your Instagram account. Toggle off Connect Contacts . Tap Disconnect .

steps.title: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Instagram website on a desktop web browser. Keep in mind that the steps going forward must be done on a computer. If you don't remember your password, you'll need to reset it .

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This is on the left side. You'll be redirected to your profile page.

steps.title: Click Edit profile.
steps.content: Click Edit profile . A menu will open.

steps.title: Click See more in Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click See more in Accounts Center . You'll be redirected to a new page.

steps.title: Click Your information and permissions.
steps.content: Click Your information and permissions . This is in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Click Manage contacts.
steps.content: Click Manage contacts . If you have more than one Instagram account linked, you'll need to select your account first to see this option.

steps.title: Click Delete all.
steps.content: Click Delete all . Currently, there's no way to delete individual contacts from Instagram; you must delete all or none.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . The contacts will be deleted. It can take up to 90 days for your contacts to be completely deleted from your Instagram.
